explanation: The report is correct. OS_strnlen uses memchr(s, 0, maxlen) with maxlen set to buffer_size supplied by the caller. Nothing in the shown code guarantees that record->name_entry has at least buffer_size accessible bytes (or that it is NUL-terminated within the first buffer_size bytes). If buffer_size is larger than the actual allocation size of name_entry, memchr may examine bytes past the end of that object, which is an out-of-bounds access and violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17. (This would only be safe if there is an invariant/contract elsewhere ensuring the storage for name_entry is always at least buffer_size bytes or the stored name is NUL-terminated within buffer_size; no such guarantee is visible in the provided code.)
